arts.ttl: Serie A | Cagliari 1-0 Verona: Match Report
arts.sum: Cagliari secured a crucial 1-0 victory against Hellas Verona on Friday evening, marking their third win of the Serie A season. The decisive goal came from Roberto Piccoli, whose poacher’s strike propelled Cagliari above Roma into 12th place in the league standings. Prior to kick-off, both teams were closely matched, with only one point separating them. Each had managed just one victory in their last five Serie A matches, intensifying the stakes for this encounter. Throughout the match, Cagliari dominated possession, holding 65% of the ball and taking 14 shots, three of which were on target. arts.ttl: Cagliari vs. Hellas Verona kicks off Matchday 14
arts.sum: Hellas Verona are only one of two teams, along with Le Havre, not to have yet drawn a match in Europe`s big five leagues in 2024/25: four wins and nine defeats in the current tournament for the Gialloblù. Hellas Verona are unbeaten in their last nine Serie A matches against Cagliari (W5 D4); this is the Gialloblù`s longest unbeaten streak in consecutive matches against a single opponent in the competition.

Cagliari are coming off a 2-2 draw against Genoa thanks to two penalties scored by Razvan Marin and Roberto Piccoli on Sunday. On the other hand, Verona are coming off a disastrous 5-0 defeat to Inte...

arts.ttl: Serie A | Cagliari v Verona: Match Preview
arts.sum: As the Serie A season approaches its midway point, Cagliari and Hellas Verona prepare for a pivotal clash at the Unipol Domus on Friday evening. With both teams embroiled in a fierce relegation battle, this match could prove crucial in determining their fate for the remainder of the season. Cagliari, currently sitting in 16th place, have shown resilience in recent weeks. After a string of three consecutive defeats, they managed to secure dramatic draws against AC Milan (3-3) and Genoa (2-2). arts.ttl: Claudio Ranieri Reflects on Retirement: “Only Roma or Cagliari Could Bring Me Back”
arts.sum: Roma manager Claudio Ranieri addressed the media in the build-up to today's UEFA Europa League game against Tottenham Hotspur. It's a must-win clash for the Giallorossi as their hopes of locking down automatic knockout qualification hang in the balance. arts.ttl: Ranieri: “The only two teams that could bring me out of retirement were Roma or Cagliari”
arts.sum: Roma coach Claudio Ranieri addressed the media ahead of the Europa League clash against Tottenham Hotspur, sharing his thoughts on the team’s recent performance and preparations. In a pre-match press conference, Ranieri expressed his awareness of the challenges that lie ahead. He began by acknowledging the strength of their opponents, stating, “It will not be an easy match, and we know that. They have won 13 out of their last 15 European matches and drawn 2.
